intro: Leucopogon opponens, commonly known as the narrow-leafed heath, is a flowering plant native to the south-western regions of Western Australia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features narrow, leathery leaves and produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in heathlands and coastal areas. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
